channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: The Concept C Shows an Audi That Doesn’t Look Like an Audi
item.dc:creator: Tyler Dupont
item.description: The Concept C surprises with daring design that’s unlike any Audi seen before.
item.content:encoded: Audi has long been associated with sleek, conservative designs that emphasize understated luxury. But the Concept C challenges that perception, offering a bold vision that departs from the brand’s usual styling cues. Its futuristic lines and daring proportions showcase a side of Audi that feels fresh, edgy, and surprisingly different from what fans might expect.

item.title: Why This Distro Is More Popular Than Ubuntu and Linux Mint Right Now
item.dc:creator: Dibakar Ghosh
item.description: How is CachyOS able to catch everyone's attention?
item.content:encoded: Have you noticed everyone talking about CachyOS lately—seemingly surpassing Ubuntu and Linux Mint in popularity? Are you wondering what makes this Arch-based newcomer so special? Let me show you why this distro is capturing everyone's attention right now.

item.title: What Are "Time Sensitive" Notifications on iPhone?
item.dc:creator: Joe Fedewa
item.description: "Time Sensitive" notifications? What does that mean?
item.content:encoded: For a long time, iPhones and iPad treated all notifications the same. You could turn them all off or do it on an app-by-app basis. Now, some notifications will be "Time Sensitive" to give you more control.

item.title: 6 Surprising Things You Can Do With Your Amazon Fire Stick’s USB Port
item.dc:creator: Andy Betts
item.description: You only use it for power, don't you?
item.content:encoded: The Micro-USB port on an Amazon Fire TV Stick is primarily designed to power the device. But with the right adapter, it can do a lot more. Here are some of the most useful things you can connect to your Fire Stick.

item.title: Hidden Gboard Tricks, Google Photos Editing, and Bad Widgets: Android This Week
item.dc:creator: Joe Fedewa
item.description: Android news, editorials, and more from the last 7 days.
item.content:encoded: This week, Qualcomm's new Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 debuted in the Xiaomi 17, and it's pretty dang fast. Google updated the Pixel Buds Pro 2 and is trying to improve the Play Store search. Also, check out a critical OnePlus vulnerability and the new Google Photos AI editor.

item.title: 3 DIY E-Ink Projects for Beginners
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: Not all DIY projects need to take a full weekend.
item.content:encoded: I love e-ink displays. The tech behind them is fascinating, especially since they can continue displaying an image after losing power. There are a lot of fun DIY projects to do with e-ink displays, and here are three of my favorites.

item.title: 7 Ways to Use SSH to Turbocharge Remote Server Connections
item.dc:creator: David Delony
item.description: Make SSH work for you with advanced options.
item.content:encoded: SSH is a ubiquituous tool for connecting to remote servers, but there are a lot of things you can do with it. Here are some techniques to make your remote sessions easier.

item.title: How I Got the Full Right-Click Menu back in Windows 11
item.dc:creator: Rich Hein
item.description: I was fed up with Windows 11’s shortened right-click menu. Here’s how I restored the full classic menu in just a few steps.
item.content:encoded: With Windows 10 end of support rapidly approaching, I’ve been upgrading several PCs to Windows 11. One thing that I always find frustrating is the new abbreviated context menus. Part of the problem is that I’ve used the classic Windows context menu for a long time, and I’m very comfortable with it. But what really irritates me is regularly needing to click “Show more options,” to drill down to things like 7Zip and other menu items that get hidden.

item.title: The iPhone 17 Pro Bulks Up On Features and Is Better For It
item.dc:creator: Tyler Hayes
item.description: Excellent battery life, better cameras, and a bold new color.
item.content:encoded: There's little ambiguity about the Apple iPhone 17 Pro this year. It gets a little bigger and heavier to make a show of putting function over form and separating itself from the iPhone Air. As such, there wasn't one specific feature— beit a 48MP telephoto lens, or extreme battery life—that makes this phone a Pro.

item.title: How to Fix Your USB Drive Not Showing Up on Windows 10 or Windows 11
item.dc:creator: Chris Hoffman
Nick Lewis
item.description: Sometimes when you plug a USB drive into your PC it doesn't show up. We're going to look at a few ways to fix that problem.
item.content:encoded: USB drives should automatically appear in File Explorer when you connect them to your computer. Follow these troubleshooting steps if your Windows 10 or Windows 11 PC doesn't show a connected drive.
